LeeumSamsung Museum of Art Hannam-dong by the Hangang River. Photo courtesy of Leeum Museum.Korea has more private art museums than any other country, according to the extensive research compiled by Larryâ€™s List.Leeum was founded by Lee Byeong-Cheol (deceased), a former president of Samsung, whose name is incorporated in the name of the museum complex. In addition to the impressive collections, the compound is famous for commissioning renown architects from three different countries to create the signature buildings. #leeum  #leeummuseum #museo #privatemuseum #korea #Seoul #privatemuseums #koreanart #modernart #contemporaryart #hangang #namsan #koolhaas #botti #jeannovel #glassandsteel #buddhistart #ceramics #samsung #samsungmuseumofart

LeeumMuseum One of the Leeum compoundSeoul, Korea(See PAMW companion posts on IG for this project). Swiss architect Mario Botta designed the hexahedron and a reverse cone to feature the traditional Korean art collection in a retrospective survey of Koreaâ€™s ceramics, metal work, Buddhist art, jewelry and more. Museum 2Leeum , Samsung Museum of ArtDesigned by French architect Jean Nouvel working with Mark Quinlan to create rusted stainless steel thus inventing the black patina of the exhibition spaces as geometric â€œboxesâ€. Along with the focus on spatial harmony with the ground and trees this building stands strong with Museum 1 designed by Botta and the Koolhaas  third building in the museum complex. Museum 2 showcases modern and contemporary works by Korean and international blue-chip artists.#privatemuseums #leeum #koolhaas #museum #museo #samsung #remkoolhaas #gallery #contemporaryart #donaldjudd #damienhirst #warhol #rothko #stainlesssteel #architecture #korea #seoul #koreanart #modernart Photo courtesy of Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art

Leeum MuseumSamsung Museum of ArtSeoul, KoreaRem Koolhaas completes the triumvirate of internationally renown  architects chosen for the Leeum museum complex. His design of the Samsung Child Education and Culture Center incorporates steel and glass with an interior â€œblack boxâ€ exhibition areas for light control and dynamic display focus.Photo courtesy of Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art. #privatemuseums #seoul, #museum #leeum #leeummuseum #children #contemporaryart #art #remkoolhaas #botta #nouvel #cultural #Samsung #korea

"...I can still sing some. Early cancer didnâ€™t stop the compulsion to sing, but thereâ€™s gravel now. An undercurrent that also reveals me. Time and disaster. A heavy landslidedown the mountain. When you stopped speaking to me what you really wanted was for me to stop speaking to you. To stifle the sound of my voice.I know.Didnâ€™t want the quicksilver of it in your ear.What does it mean to silence another? It means I ruminate on the hit of rain against the tin roof of childhood, how I could listenall day until the water rusted its way in. And there I was putting a pan over here and a pot over there to catch it."~ excerpt from "Given to Rust" by Vivee Francis | Sculpture: Grand Crinkly (1971) by Alexander Calder#calder #art #poetry #southkorea #seoul #leeum #latergram

The odyssey of space which hides and reveals itselfArchitecture that doesnâ€™t â€œshowâ€. How is it possible? Rem KoolHaas, an avant-garde contemporary architect who has been searching for the answers to this question, claims, â€œI am interested in how the architecture creates, strengthens, and makes flexible the flow of the event to create transparency.â€ You can see the designs of Rem KoolHaas, who considers architecture a flow and a city, in The Leeum, Samsung Museum of Artâ€™s master plan and Samsung Child Education & Culture Center.The architectâ€™s intention and influence are minimized in Rem KoolHaasâ€™s design. When he was commissioned to build Samsung Child Education & Culture Center, he had suggested building a line that would connect each building organically. He says that all he has done is create a natural flow of the surfaces of the glass wall in the parking space and of the Samsung Child Education & Culture Center, along with the borderline of the ground.However, in that quiet flow, a powerful future space is developing. A gigantic black box, visible through glasses, and a flexible space of 17 meters, which encompasses the black box, is an architectural exploit enabling audiences to experience different spaces, along different time lines, and different paths of action. Rem KoolHaas has actively participated in solving the fundamental problem of embracing and controlling the ground to place Leeumâ€™s MUSEUM 1 and MUSEUM 2 and Samsung Child Education & Culture Center in overall harmony.Rem KoolHaas intention for a subtle design has upgraded this building complex as an example of harmony and inner circulation within a city.The Samsung Child Education & Culture Center is one of the plans which best exemplifies Rem Koolhaasâ€™s quotation: â€œArchitecture is a collision between an insight and an environmental reality.â€ #remkoolhaas #remkoolhaasarchitect #leeum #museum #museumdesign #arch #architecture #architecturephotography #architecturelovers

Rem KoolHaas has actively participated in solving the fundamental problem of embracing and controlling the ground to place Leeumâ€™s MUSEUM 1 and MUSEUM 2 and Samsung Child Education & Culture Center in overall harmony.Rem KoolHaas intention for a subtle design has upgraded this building complex as an example of harmony and inner circulation within a city.The Samsung Child Education & Culture Center is one of the plans which best exemplifies Rem Koolhaasâ€™s quotation: â€œArchitecture is a collision between an insight and an environmental reality.â€ #remkoolhaas #remkoolhaasarchitect #leeum #museum #museumdesign #arch #architecture #architecturephotography #architecturelovers

Last week I went to the Samsung Leeum museum with friends and went to the Alive museum afterwards. It was a very fun and eventful day ğŸ˜Š Can't believe this was over a week ago already.Leeum Museum had a traditional art section as well as modern which was nice to see that they were separated. There were those cool giant rings and also a room made up of all mirrors.The Alive Museum also had this thing called Dynamic Maze which was a super fun (and exhausting) obstacle course in which you have to find your way out. It took us a good 20 to 30 minutes xD it was tiring but worth the experience. Sadly no pictures of the Dynamic Maze cuz I didn't wanna lose my phone.#Leeum #Korea #SouthKorea #Travel #Friends #AliveMuseum #DynamicMaze #SamsungMuseum #2018KUISC

#RemKoolhaas museum at #Leeum is a simple enclosure which forms ramped public circulation into the linked-up basement, and contains exhibition spaces within a black concrete box

#JeanNouvelâ€™s museum at #Leeum is carved out of the hillside. The front is clad with black steel while the glass back side faces a three storey gabion retaining wall which lets indirect lighting into the gallery spaces.

#JeanNouvelâ€™s museum at #Leeum is carved out of the hillside. The front is clad with black steel while the glass back side faces a three storey gabion retaining wall which lets indirect lighting into the gallery spaces.

#MarioBottaâ€™s museum at #Leeum was my favourite. Itâ€™s quintessential Botta with strong geometric forms and a brick facade. The experience of each level of dark galleries is contrasted with a flight of stairs through the cone-shaped central courtyard. Theoretically, I shouldnâ€™t like Bottaâ€™s work but I have loved every single one that I have seen (and Iâ€™ve seen quite a few).

: q0.  2014. 5. 25. Crank in The production process for q0 has begun. A video work based on the â€œShell Ornament with Twin Deer in Gold and Silver (a traditional Korean craftwork in the collection of Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art)," q0 is based on a fictitious plot that traces the origin and history of the ornament. Through a narrative that interweaves past, present, and future, the work deals with the cyclical and paradoxical nature of life.  Through a poetic visual with episodes of full-fledged imaginative power and reference to various discourse that freely travels across time and space, q0 will investigate the existential problems in the light of the continuous cycle of conflict in world history with the intention to invoke a philosophical introspection and self-awakening experience.  The work will premiere at Leeum Samung Museum of Art from August 28, 2014 for a special exhibition celebrating the museumâ€™s 10th year anniversary.-#moonkyungwon #jeonjoonho #MoonandJeon #q0 #leeum #leeummuseum #ë¬¸ê²½ì› #ì „ì¤€í˜¸ #ë¬¸ê²½ì›ì „ì¤€í˜¸

: q0. 2014. HD Film. 19min. 50sec. Installation viewThe latest work of Moon Kyungwon and Jeon Joonho produced through the sponsorship of Leeum, q0, was exhibited in the â€œBeyond Art and Peopleâ€ section in the black box of the special exhibition space alongside actual cultural relics. â€œ The work produced for this exhibition, q0, is a video installation portraying a relationship between art and life that transcends time. A component of the work, Decorated Clam Shells, is a rare relic from the United Silla period that belongs to the Leeumâ€™s collection. It is decorated in gold and silver using the pyongtal technique, and depicts a peaceful scene of a pair of deer grazing on clam shells. Moon and Jeon have transformed the creation and history of this relic into a fictional story, generating a narrative about reincarnation that combines past, present, and future. The male and female protagonists in the story play multiple roles, crossing between episodes and portraying various periods and characters. The poetic, visual, and symbolic narratives that unfold from the decorated shells describe aspects of human history that transcend time and context, such as love, desire, belief, and regret. In addition, the actual relic installed on the back of the screen is revealed when the video ends, such that the fictional story overlaps experientially with the present moment.â€-#q0 #moonkyungwon #jeonjoonho #moonandjeon #ë¬¸ê²½ì› #ì „ì¤€í˜¸ #ë¬¸ê²½ì›ì „ì¤€í˜¸ #leeum #ë¦¬ì›€ë¯¸ìˆ ê´€

8th century mirror adorned with mother of pearl, amber and turquoise shown as part of special exhibition at Leeum - â€œOpulence: Treasures of Korean Traditional Craftâ€. The exhibit shows the very uniquely Korean aesthetics of design, proportions, combination of materials and techniques. The exhibition itself is so well designed from the display cases, lighting and the flow. I particularly loved that they displayed modern paintings amidst the collection of traditional items. http://leeum.samsungfoundation.org/html_eng/exhibition/main_view.asp?seq=26 #leeum

Spent a wonderful morning at Leeum Samsung Museum of Art in Seoul. Fantastic collection and a great free audio guide. Highlights included Choi Jeong Hwa, Cindy Sherman, Zeng Fanzhi, Anish Kapoor and Jean-Michel Basquiat. #leeum #samsungart #seoul #korea #artmuseum #anishkapoor #choijeonghwa

Art museums for me are a hit or miss. Iâ€™m usually 100% obsessed and canâ€™t be dragged out of the place or I fly through and canâ€™t remember a single artists name. Iâ€™ve never been to an art museum in Korea that I wasnâ€™t 100% obsessed with. This was no exception. Art Museums here do a great job of including the viewer in the experience and allowing them to take in, observe and manipulate the artists work in their own way, allowing for a more personal viewing experience. Architect: Mario BottaLocation: Seoul, South KoreaCompleted: 2004...#architecture #mariobotta #museum #leeum #seoul #seoulmuseum #artmuseum #winter #samsungmuseumofart #southkorea #facade #ewinterlight #light #terracotta #terracottatiles #botta #archdaily #dezeen #architracker #architravel #instagood #photography #archiphotography

More beautiful Seoul art and architecture ğŸ˜ This is the rotunda of the Leeum Samsung Museum and a must-see if you visit Seoul! There are two buildings here: the first designed by architect Mario Botta houses a collection of traditional Korean art, including celadon pottery and folk and landscape paintings, with a few complementary modern pieces mixed in (like this hanging sculpture â€œAlchemyâ€ by Choi Jeong-hwa). The second museum, designed by Jean Nouvel, houses contemporary art by Korean and foreign artists. Photos arenâ€™t allowed in the museum except for a few areas like the rotunda and outdoor sculpture park..I loved the exhibits in both museums and could have looked at the celadon pottery and brushstrokes of the paintings all day! Gravity stairs ğŸ’› 'In Gravity stairs, visitors traverse a stairway beneath an enormous, schematic model of our solar system created through an arrangement of mirrors and lit ring segments. [...] By mirroring the visitor as well as the rings, the vast reflective environment subsumes the spectator within the artwork, highlighting the unique impact achieved by her presence. In this way, the work builds upon the artist's interest in the solar system, not as a given fact that must be accepted as such, but rather as a model capable of assuming myriad subjective forms.'@studioolafureliasson

In a city driven by design and modern architecture and filled with artworks all over, we couldn't miss Samsung's Leeum Museum of Art. An excellent collection of traditional Korean pottery, calligraphy, painting and sculpture and local and international contemporary art. Definitely worth a full day visit.#seoul #korea #art #contemporaryart #architecture #leeum #leeummuseum #backpacking

One of my favorite places on my visit to Seoul was the Leeum Museum of Art. So many pieces not just modern art, but also national treasures of Korean history. The country is rich in art, history, and a dedication to the preservation of its past and future. History & nature museums will be must visit for every new destination, but an ART museum? Letâ€™s give it a try......Both of us are not art aficionados, we started with a bit of struggle at the Celadon exhibit, but as soon as we reached the Paintings exhibit we started to move smoothly from one piece to the next one......Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art houses a wide array of Korean traditional & modern art and international contemporary art. Situated in the suburb part of Itaewon, this museum is worth to visit for you who would like to see how art & technology can collide....#leeum #leeummuseum #samsungmuseumofart #itaewon #museumofart #itaewon #seoul #southkorea #autumn #autumntrip #artmuseum #seoulmuseum #sweetnovember #novemberrain #latepost

Day 7 of South Korea Trip: Visited the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art. Leeum is an open museum where traditional and contemporary Korean art as well as international art converge. Tagged as a smart museum where visitors can appreciate different works of after with the aid of Samsung technology (high definition displays and digital interactive solution system.) First time using an audio guide while inside a museum and seeing works of other international artists like Kapoor and Rothko. ğŸ¯

Walking around the city and discovering new art. Contemporary art is my favourite form far. I was delighted to compare Korean and Asian pieces in general with western ones. Beautiful exhibition!.Wearing sustainable fashion as much as possible ofc! Organic cotton jeans, vegan bag, old sneakers! .I have to admit I bought the jumper randomly as it is freezing here and that I could not find any sustainable fashion brands. Shame on me, I know... but on a good note, I will make sure I take good care of it and make it last as long as I can. .....#whereischarlie #seoul #korea #travel #trip #explore #wanderlust #art #museum #modernart #selfie #love #fun #frenchgirl #mirror #artmuseum #leeummuseum #leeum #contemporaryart #samsungmuseumofart #ethicalfashion #sustainablefashion #ecofashion #ecotravel #vegangirl #ethicalliving #veganfashion

Tall Tree and the Eye â„¢ â€¢ A stainless and carbon steel sculpture by Anish Kapoor at the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art Â® â€¢ In this powerful 45ft-tall work, each sphere reflects itself in its neighboring spheres at a point in space that the eye cannot always define, multiplying its surroundings in an infinite ascension towards the sky. As enticing as this sculpture is to photograph with its intended reflective qualities, I decided to shoot this work without reflection, dissolving the focus and presenting it as an abstracted form. â€¢ Seoul, Korea Â©

Contrast of old and new. The Samsung Museum of Art is split in two - One is traditional with Korean ink paintings, ceramics and Buddhist art (interspersed with modern pieces like Rothko, Giacometti and a beautiful bronze by Do Ho Suh). The other half of the gallery is modern and contemporary art - some great expressionist pieces as well as Ronj Hornâ€™s â€˜Ten Liquid Incidentsâ€™ cast in solid glass.#seoul #leeum #southkorea #art

Chakram, the wielder is both adept in range and hand-to-hand combat. Range damage 140 melee 120. 8% chance to inflict bleed status to enemies, lasts 10 seconds. Non-tradeable, boss drop item. lmao idk why but the moment i saw this installation/fixture, i immediately thought of the weapon chakram.
Heading back home after getting to know this inspiring place a bit better. South Korea. #southkorea #northkorea #dmz #dmzlab #leeum #samsung

The Leeum Museum was a worthwhile stop in Seoul. The collection was championed by the wife of the owner of Samsung, and is comprised of 3 buildings; one by Rem Koolhaas, Another by Jean Nouvel, and this one (the Korean collection of traditional art) by Mario Botta. This photo shows the central rotunda of the building; really the heart of the space in which the collection radiates around. Itâ€™s pretty impressive in its volumes,  etherial qualities and plays on light, shadow, and textures. The walls are a subtle Venetian plaster. Ğ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»ÑĞ´Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ˜Ñ‚ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑˆĞ¸ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¸Ñ… Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ², ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… ĞºĞ°Ñ„Ğµ Ğ¸ ÑˆĞ¾ÑƒÑ€ÑƒĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ². Ğ•ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ»ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ² ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ ÑĞµÑ€Ğ´Ñ†Ğµ, Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑÑ‰ÑƒÑ ĞºÑ€Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ñ‚Ñƒ ğŸ’“ *** What's so special about Itaewon?Itaewon is a multicultural district of Seoul, so-called 'non-korean Korea'. For quite a long time Itaewon was for me just a bunch of shops selling foreign goods and restaurants with unreasonably high prices. It's funny that only here you can see korean policemen walking in groups, especially in the evening. It is more like just displaying, but it is still recommended to be more careful in Itaewon.I was coming to Itaewon quite often but didn't like it. I saw only a crowd and grey streets in it.But I was mistaken. If you walk away from subway station you will be able to see many interesting things. Leeum museum became the biggest discovery I had in Itaewon, and I'll talk about it later. Quiet part of Itaewon is very luxurious and consists of expensive private houses, awesome cafes and showrooms. If you get lost in the heart of this district, you will surely see its special beauty ğŸ’“#olgahensky #korea #seoul #itaewon #leeum #koreanblog #travelblog #studykorean #architecture

Reasons I love Korea no.103 - Jean Nouvel.#becausekorea

Finding balance is integral to moving towards a future of success. #Flymetofriday is introspectively looking at Art this week. Where modern art synergizes with art of cultural and historical significance is the path towards Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art @leeum_officialIn 2004, Samsung Museum of Art, which has strived to preserve Korea's cultural heritage and share it with the public under the efforts of the Samsung Foundation of Culture, established in 1965, opened Leeum, Samsung Museum of art. Nestled in Hannam-dong in buildings newly constructed for the museum, Leeum has now grown into one of the aleading museums of Korea, through notable activities and accomplishments, including exhibitions of its highly-regarded collection and special exhibitions. It comprises two parts that house traditional Korean art and contemporary art. Museum 1 is designed by Swiss architect Mario Botta and Museum 2 is by French architect Jean Nouvel and Dutch architect Rem Koolhaas designed the Samsung Child Education & Culture Center.Admission for adults: 10,000â‚© (~$70ttd) and the digital audio guide 1,000 â‚© ($7ttd)Korea Art Week 2016 (October 11 - 23) : 50% off admission ( best time to visit to get the most out of your museum tour) Review from admin @lostandfoundtraveler : I visited during Art week without even knowing. Museums can be a good way to learn a vast amount about history and culture of a country in one day. The traditional exhibition really captured my attention... Filled with pottery during multiple dynasties and calligraphy from renowned historical scholars. Cool thing about the digital guide - it senses when you have walked to a new piece of artwork using the recognition sensors on the piece and automatically starts playing the information about the piece. This must be the work of @samsungmobile !!! Really where modern meets the past. The modern art exhibit was quite awe provoking with eclectic and fluid styles all curated into one exhibition. Very interactive with large and small indoor pieces of architecture and painting, as well as, huge outdoor art ( pictured in this post). Cr: @lostandfoundtraveler  and Leeum Samsung Museum#kxpott  #leeumsamsungmuseumofart

Museum 1 is designed by Swiss architect Mario Botta and Museum 2 is by French architect Jean Nouvel and Dutch architect Rem Koolhaas designed the Samsung Child Education & Culture Center.Admission for adults: 10,000â‚© (~$70ttd) and the digital audio guide 1,000 â‚© ($7ttd)Korea Art Week 2016 (October 11 - 23) : 50% off admission ( best time to visit to get the most out of your museum tour) Review from admin @lostandfoundtraveler : I visited during Art week without even knowing. Museums can be a good way to learn a vast amount about history and culture of a country in one day. The traditional exhibition really captured my attention... Filled with pottery during multiple dynasties and calligraphy from renowned historical scholars. Cool thing about the digital guide - it senses when you have walked to a new piece of artwork using the recognition sensors on the piece and automatically starts playing the information about the piece. This must be the work of @samsungmobile !!! Really where modern meets the past. The modern art exhibit was quite awe provoking with eclectic and fluid styles all curated into one exhibition. Very interactive with large and small indoor pieces of architecture and painting, as well as, huge outdoor art ( pictured in this post). In fact, it is a complex of three buildings created by Mario Botta, Jean Nouvel and Rem Koolhaas (OMG!) If these names didnâ€™t impress you, still visit it â€“ at least you will surely get awesome photos for Instagram.Price policy of the Leeum is really friendly: people under 24 and students (also seniors and disabled) get 50% discount, and the ticket will cost just 5 000 won. Make sure you bring student card and ID card.Leeum shop is situated on the first floor where you can find gorgeous souvenirs and art works. The prices are quite high, but the beautiful design will make you buy something. It is possible to leave personal belongings in the lockers (no charge) and freely enjoy the exhibition. Finally, the cafÃ© designed by famous British artist will be a good place to relax after a long walk.#olgahensky #korea #seoul #leeum #koreanblogger #travelblogger #museums #architecture #photography #ĞºĞ¾Ñ€ĞµÑ #ÑĞµÑƒĞ» #ĞºĞ¾Ñ€ĞµÑĞ±Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ³

Like a gnat in the night, Iâ€™m seduced by Seoul and its light. Two days have passed, too few to really know a city. But like the mirrors that bring together the other half of this work, Seoul has found a way to fill my experience here both emotionally and physically with its food, art, and all around culture.â€”I may forever be a tourist in this town even though I so long to reach the gold.â€”#OlafurEliasson #LeeumMuseum #SeoulKorea #ArtDrunkInKorea #InstallationArt #LightArt #ArtMuseum #SouthKorea #ë¦¬ì›€ #Leeum #SamsungMuseumOfArt

Lee Bul(b.1964), one of South Koreaâ€™s most preeminent artists also active in the international art world, is awarded with the 29th Ho-Am Prize for The Arts from organized by Ho-Am Foundation..The Ho-Am Prize was established in 1990 by Kun-Hee Lee, the Chairman of Samsung, with a vision to create a new corporate culture that continues the noble spirit of public service espoused by the late Chairman Byung-chull Lee, founder of Samsung. The Prize is presented each year to individuals who have contributed to academics, the arts, and social development, or who have furthered the welfare of humanity through distinguished accomplishments in their respective professional fields. The previous laureates of The Prize for The Arts include Video Artist Nam June Paik, Movie Director Kwon Taek Im, Writer Kyung-sook Shin, and Opera Singer Kwangchul Youn..Lee has won significant international recognition for her recent solo exhibitions at Hayward Gallery, London and Gropius Bau, Berlin and for displaying her work at the Encounter Section of Art Basel Hong Kong 2019. Lee is not only the first Korean artist to be selected for the main show of the 58th Venice Biennale 2019, but also the first Korean artist to be re-invited to the Venice Biennale in twenty years. Later this year, PKM Gallery will present a solo exhibition of the artist held in three years since her previous show at the gallery in 2016..The award ceremony will take place at Ho-Am Art Hall on May 31, 2019...Lee Bul. Bell from the Deep, 2014, Cast polyurethane, acrylic paint, mirrors, two-way mirror, glass, LED lighting, wood, enamel paint, 370 x 360 x 330 cm. A sculpture by the guy who bought the rights to Vantablack

Being back in Taiwan is the first time in six years that I've seen any of my relatives. It's a homecoming of sorts where I'm hearing stories that I remember and many that I don't. Most sobering are those of my grandparents and thinking about how they have lived nearly nine decades. In many conversations or simply observing from afar, my mind unavoidably drifts to the abstraction that is the passing of time.â€”Each of Kapoor's spheres draws the same reflections as my eyes climb higher. With each year, another layer is added and the perspective from below begins to shift. What at first is largely a view of the ground where I'm standing eventually transitions to show the curve of the earth - the bigger picture comes into view. I feel like life is a marathon, a burden sometimes, to reach that point.â€”My grandparents are sleeping now - both on the couch as we're all crammed into my aunt's apartment. For what I consider too slow paced a life (I am in my 20s after all), they still carry smiles all around, like they've put in their work and now sit perched at the top of the tower they've built. The thought then turns to nature taking its course, rusting away the metal below before it too will be absorbed back into the earth from where we all first set foot.â€”#AnishKapoor #AlexanderCalder #LeeumMuseum #Leeum #SamsungMuseum #ArtDrunkInKorea

Leeum, Samsung Museum of ArtMuseum opened by the Samsung Cultural Foundation.  It consists of three exposures; the first two are permanent, and the third is periodically updated.  The first presents traditional Korean art.  The second includes works of modern art of Korea and the World. The #LeeumMuseum - Samsung Museum of Art is a precious black-grey steel structure that nestles into a great vertical cavity composed of stone gabions. The complementarity between the permanence of the steel structure and the temporary feel of the gabion walls creates internal tension.

Park Soo-Keun is widely regarded as the father of modern #koreanart. Born in Yanggu-gun in Gangwon Province in 1914, Park was entirely self-taught as an #artist and even though he was an avid #painter, entering and often winning numerous #art competitions and exhibitions, it was only upon his move to #seoul in 1952 that Park became a full-time painter and made his living from it (albeit barely during his rather lonely lifetime). Parkâ€™s work explores the Korean experience in a rather simple and sincere way, taking #korean folklore themes as his foundation for a more penetrating exploration of contemporary #korea; a country which was at war with itself between 1950 and 1953 and which resulted in the bifurcation of a nation - physically, politically and emotionally. Parkâ€™s body of work seems to return to an ancient, innocent Korea and a time that spoke of an uncomplicated life of ordinary people. â€œTree and Two Womenâ€ from 1962 and in the #leeum #museum in Seoul is a celebrated example of Parkâ€™s aesthetic. Executed in his signature palette of creamy, stony greys, and effecting a textured surface not unlike granite, Park depicts two women standing under a withered #tree; one carries a baby on her back whilst the other carries a wooden bowl on her head. It is a beautifully poetic moment; a passage of painting that is deliberately timeless rebounding to a virtuous past as a way of both inoculating oneself from, yet also understanding the ravaged violence of the present. The tree of life that here sustains Korea is parched; its decayed branches languidly stretching out across the canvas, providing little comfort to the hurried women who strive to nurture themselves, their children and their families underneath it. This is a painting both archival and portentous; both real and imagined, and full with the hushed muffles of hope. #parksookeun died #otd in 1965 aged 51. #mcwrip #artistsoninstagram #koreansdoitbetter #bigbangvip

Silla Shoes, 5th-6th century, Gilt Bronze. From Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art, Seoul. Unlike other gilt-bronze shoes that have been found at Baekje and Goguryeo sites, these have plain, undecorated bottoms, which seem to be a characteristic of metal shoes made in Silla. Judging from the size and shape of these shoes, we can assume that they were not intended actually to be worn but were for ritual purposes. #leeum #leeummuseum #seoul #korea #gilt #bronze #slippers #shoes #fashion #ritual #travel #museum #korean #koreanhandcraft #samsung #samsungmuseumofart #history #historyofcostume

we are rule breakers. pictures were not allowed on this section of @leeum_official in south korea, but we couldnâ€™t help it. the year is 2019 and some places still donâ€™t realize that a lot of visitors see contemporary art museums primarily as a great source for instagram content. i canâ€™t think of a better way to connect young generations with art and, at the same time, advertise the museumâ€™s collection for free. forbid people to take pictures in museums is a lost battle because people will take them anyway (like we did). just click on the museumâ€™s location to see the amount of photos taken at this same spot. @inhotim in brazil dropped this rule in 2015 and everyone is happier. museum managers: donâ€™t be naive (to not realize that social media is a powerful and unstoppable tool) or stupid (to reject all the free advertising made through instagram). what do you think about this? #art #leeum #seoul #southkorea

The central staircase of the Leeum Museum Building 1 is memorizing. The building symbolized traditional Korean pottery and is filled with a mix of traditional celadon and white pottery, metal work, and modern art. A little bit of art and architecture today in The Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art; a museum in Hannam-dong, Yongsan-gu, Seoul, South Korea, run by the Samsung Foundation of Culture. It comprises two parts that house traditional Korean art and contemporary art. Museum 1 is designed by Swiss architect Mario Botta and Museum 2 is by French architect Jean Nouvel and Dutch architect Rem Koolhaas designed the Samsung Child Education & Culture Center. #Leeum #Museum #Korea #Seoul #Art #Architecture #Interior #SpiralStair #Gallery

A little bit of bling in The Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art is a museum in Hannam-dong, Yongsan-gu, Seoul, South Korea, run by the Samsung Foundation of Culture.[1] It comprises two parts that house traditional Korean art and contemporary art. Looking up at â€œAlchemy,â€ @choijeonghwa_official's piece for the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art in Seoul. The work â€œstrikes a harmony with the architecture,â€ said June Young Kwak, a @leeum_official curator. â€œItâ€™s well-matched.â€ The piece makes use of natural light to turn plastic and industrial materials into something more. In designing the #spiralstaircase that showcases this work of art, @mariobottaarchitetti_official was inspired by ceramics and porcelain design. The natural light that reaches from the rotunda down to the lobby represented a shift from the traditional idea of the museum â€” a white box without windows. And, June added, it's simply more welcoming. MUSEUM 1, as itâ€™s known, is meant to resemble a fortress from the outside. It was built in 2004 to house the Leeum's permanent collection of traditional Korean art. More than 120 pieces of traditional art are displayed over 4 floors, and about 5 years ago, the museum added contemporary works to MUSEUM 1 to foster dialogue between the two. #BehindTheDesign: Throughout June, weâ€™re exploring design in #Seoul.ğŸ“¸: @junmichaelpark... #theworldneedsmorespiralstaircases #leeum #samsung #ì—¬í–‰ #ì—¬í–‰ìŠ¤íƒ€ê·¸ë¨ #í•œêµ­ì—¬í–‰ #ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· #lookingup #rotunda #architecture #architectural #architecturephotography

@leeum_official is comprised of 3 buildings designed by 3 renowned architects: #MarioBotta, #JeanNouvel and #RemKoolhaas. That's part of what makes the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art so special: â€œIt's really rare to see 3 big architects work together to build one museum,â€ said the curator June Young Kwak, who has been with the museum for 7 years. The buildings, she said, are both works of art themselves and spaces for artwork. MUSEUM 1, seen here, was designed by @mariobottaarchitetti_official. â€œHe used terra cotta tiles to realize the upside-down cone shape,â€ June said. â€œIt looks like a fortress, and symbolizes our desire to conserve and protect traditional values.â€ MUSEUM 2, designed by Jean Nouvel, was built using blackened stainless steel â€” â€œquite a contrast to the typical, modern white cube,â€ June said. The Leeum, which opened in Seoul in 2004, showcases a range of traditional art and modern and contemporary art. Visitors can choose where to begin. â€œSome people start from the traditional work,â€ June said. â€œThen contemporary. It's up to each of the spectators.â€#BehindTheDesign: Throughout June, weâ€™re exploring design in #Seoul. This staircase in the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art could have been a simple path from one place to another. But in collaboration with this work art â€” â€œGravity,â€ by @studioolafureliasson â€” it became an experience. Eliason, who installed the piece when the museum opened, was inspired by outer space, said the @leeum_official curator June Young Kwak. His solar system connects the museum's lobby with MUSEUM 1, designed by @mariobottaarchitetti_official. The Leeum has two other bulldogs: MUSEUM 2, designed by Jean Nouvel, and an education center, designed by Rem Koolhaas. While the museum was founded to showcase traditional art, it now includes contemporary art, as well, and aims to foster a dialogue between the two. As June put it, the #Leeum holds â€œa lot of national treasures.â€ ğŸ’›#BehindTheDesign: Throughout June, weâ€™re exploring design in #Seoul. #repost @design_@leeum_official is comprised of 3 buildings designed by 3 renowned architects: #MarioBotta, #JeanNouvel and #RemKoolhaas. That's part of what makes the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art so special: â€œIt's really rare to see 3 big architects work together to build one museum,â€ said the curator June Young Kwak, who has been with the museum for 7 years. The buildings, she said, are both works of art themselves and spaces for artwork. MUSEUM 1, seen here, was designed by @mariobottaarchitetti_official. â€œHe used terra cotta tiles to realize the upside-down cone shape,â€ June said. â€œIt looks like a fortress, and symbolizes our desire to conserve and protect traditional values.â€ MUSEUM 2, designed by Jean Nouvel, was built using blackened stainless steel â€” â€œquite a contrast to the typical, modern white cube,â€ June said. The Leeum, which opened in Seoul in 2004, showcases a range of traditional art and modern and contemporary art. Visitors can choose where to begin. â€œSome people start from the traditional work,â€ June said. â€œThen contemporary. It's up to each of the spectators.â€#BehindTheDesign: Throughout June, weâ€™re exploring design in #Seoul. @Regrann de @design: This staircase in the Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art could have been a simple path from one place to another. But in collaboration with this work art â€” â€œGravity,â€ by @studioolafureliasson â€” it became an experience. Eliason, who installed the piece when the museum opened, was inspired by outer space, said the @leeum_official curator June Young Kwak. His solar system connects the museum's lobby with MUSEUM 1, designed by @mariobottaarchitetti_official. The Leeum has two other bulldogs: MUSEUM 2, designed by Jean Nouvel, and an education center, designed by Rem Koolhaas. While the museum was founded to showcase traditional art, it now includes contemporary art, as well, and aims to foster a dialogue between the two. As June put it, the #Leeum holds â€œa lot of national treasures.â€ ğŸ’›#BehindTheDesign: Throughout June, weâ€™re exploring design in #Seoul. A #throwback to seeing Anish Kapoor's "Tall Tree and Eye" (2009) at the Leeum, Samsung Art Museum. This elegant sculpture is made of polished stainless steel mirrored orbs. Like many of his contemporary works, it reflects the immediate environment and in turn, explores balance, form, rhythm, and space. ________________________________#AnishKapoor #SamsungMuseumOfArt #painterlyaccents

Gravity Stairs by @studioolafureliasson (2014) -This installation models after the solar system through an arrangement of mirrors and ring segments. Walking down the stairs, you realize that the staircase as well as yourselves, the visitors, are reflected onto the mirrors on the ceiling. At the same time, this entire space is also reflected onto the gigantic mirrors in front of you. Hence, every step you take is actually affecting the space on three different surfaces. Works that engage with mirrors and reflective surfaces are particularly interesting to me because of how audience participation becomes a part of the work. Everytime you stand in front of a work with mirrors, it changes the work. And when you leave, it changes again. -#olafureliasson #yellow #gravitystairs #installation #olafur #tatemodern #leeum #samsung #museum #mirrors #installation #lights #solarsystem #environment #seoul #seoulart #artoninstagram

â€œThe Translated Vaseâ€ series by my favorite ceramic artist Yee Soo-Kyung. I came across her work for the first time at 2017 Venice Art Biennale, and I was so moved. Nowadays her work is ubiquitous at major museums & art fairs #yeesookyung ..She collects broken ceramic shards from Korean artisans creating Koryeo and Chosun dynasty style ceramics, particularly in celadon and porcelain. The details on her work help tell a story of suffering in people who were subject to consistent violence but continue to build a saga from their broken pieces of dreams and almosts..To suffer is the baseline condition for all human life, while to build from the suffering and to bloom is our continuous task. Regardless of our ethnicities and background, we will always share that in common as one human race. #artphilosophy #artistsoninstagram #asianartmuseum #courtauld #leeum

Like so many of Alexander Calder's stabile-mobiles, they all seem to radiate dynamic lightness, rhythm, and freshness in public spaces. It was an absolute delight to come across Calder's "Grand Crinkly" (1971) at the Leeum, Samsung Museum earlier last month. Encouraged by Piet Mondrian, Calder began experimenting with primary colors in his work. Although I've seen several of his works in the US, this is the first Calder sculpture I've encountered in Asia  @leeum_official_______________________________#AlexanderCalder #SamsungMuseumOfArt #painterlyaccents

When you wake up in the morning, excited about your first full day that you're going to spend at your travel destination and about the plans you've made, your eyes still being closed, but you can hear your hostel's room mates whispering to each other: "Did you hear about the typhoon coming up today?" - "Yeah, they say it's gonna be dangerous to go outside." Then you understand, that you're not off to the best vacation start possible. Typhoon Lingling definitely rained on my parade that day (and according to the news hit the peninsula quite badly), but eventually I was lucky and didn't get affected too much apart from having to replan to indoor activities. No regrets though, since the Leeum was definitely worth a visit: Exhibiting both traditional Korean and contemporary art, presented in an architecturally captivating space, including these winding stairs, spiraling down to the museum's lobby like a tropical storm. - "Memories of the future"#typhoon #leeum #ë¦¬ì›€Â #stairsandsteps #worldneedsmorespiralstaircases #tv_spiralstaircases #ig_ometry #geometryart #total_geometric_forms #geometrygrammer #archi_focus_on #gf_architecture #rsa_architecture #1_unlimited #archi_unlimited #architecture_minimal #ig_mnms #minimal_mood #pocket_minimal #arte_minimal #mnm_gram #jj_minimalarts #minimalshot #whyconcept #museumlife #artmuseums #seoul_korea #exploreseoul #seoulsearching #ig_seoul

Earlier this year, I've been to an exhibition of artist Lee Bul in Berlin, but I completely forgot about the fact that she's from Korea! So I was both surprised and not so surprised, but definitely happy to bump into her work again. And strangely enough, immersing in this odd neon world felt a bit like being home. - "Memories of the future"#leeum #leebul #immersiveart #neonaesthetic #ig_ometry #total_geometric_forms #geometrygrammer #arkiminimalÂ  #arte_minimal #jj_geometry #total_minimal #patternart #patternplay #mirrorart #soulminimalist #artwatchers #museumvisit #museumofmodernart #museumlife #artmuseums #museumart #museumlover #artexpo #instamuseum #lastingvisuals #marvelshot #seoul_korea #exploreseoul #seoulsearching #ig_seoul

You only feel the one yearning at best,Oh, never seek to know the other!Two souls, alas, exist in my breast,One separated from another:One, with its crude love of life, justClings to the world, tenaciously, grips tight,The other soars powerfully above the dust,Into the far ancestral height.___#leeum#leeummuseum#leeumsamsungmuseumofart#seoulart#faust#goethe#playingwiththelight#shadows#artist#playing
